meanings.definition: The official currency of the European Union.
meanings.sent1: I used a euro to buy a snack.
meanings.sent2: She exchanged dollars for euros before her trip.
meanings.sent3: The euro rolled off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent4: His savings were like a pile of euros, waiting to be spent.
meanings.sent5: The shiny euro coin gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in several European countries.
meanings.sent1: The price was listed in euros and cents.
meanings.sent2: He received a few euros as a gift from his aunt.
meanings.sent3: The euro in his pocket jingled as he walked.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was worth more than a handful of euros.
meanings.sent5: The euro bills were neatly stacked on the counter.

meanings.definition: A symbol representing the euro currency.
meanings.sent1: The logo featured a stylized euro symbol.
meanings.sent2: She drew a euro on the chalkboard during the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The euro symbol on the sign caught my eye.
meanings.sent4: His love for travel was as strong as the euro symbol.
meanings.sent5: The necklace pendant was shaped like a euro.
